container.heading: Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern

section.heading: Areas Designated as Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern.
section.text: Maps of areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern shall be maintained by the Department and available for public review. Areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern are listed below:

tr.td: North East, Havre De Grace, Bay View
Brandywine, Hughesville, La Plata, Popes Creek, Charlotte Hall

section.heading: Areas Designated as Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern Located in the Critical Area.

para.text: Maps of areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern in the Critical Area shall be maintained by the Department and available for public review. Areas designated as nontidal wetlands of special State concern in the Critical Area are listed in §§B—Q of this regulation.

tr.td: (2) Cypress Creek Swamp Natural Heritage Area
(9) Upper Patuxent Marshes Natural Heritage Area
C. Baltimore County—Black Marsh Natural Heritage Area
(2) Cove Point Marsh Natural Heritage Area
(4) Randle Cliff Beach Natural Heritage Area
(5) Upper Nanjemoy Creek Natural Heritage Area
(6) Upper Blackwater River Natural Heritage Area
(7) Upper Nanticoke River, Marshes, and Swamps Natural Heritage Area
(3) Upper Patuxent Marshes Natural Heritage Area
L. Queen Anne's County—Tuckahoe Creek North
(3) Hickory Point Cypress Swamp Natural Heritage Area
(5) Upper Nanticoke River, Marshes, and Swamps Natural Heritage Area
(4) Lower Nassawango Creek Natural Heritage Area

section.heading: Best Management Practices for Nontidal Wetlands of Special State Concern and Expanded Buffers.
section.text: If a permit or other authorization is granted, the Department may require an applicant to comply with best management practices, including one or more of the following:

para.text: Protect against future disturbances to the nontidal wetland of special State concern by showing its surveyed boundary, expanded buffer, waterways, and 100-year floodplains on the property deed, and recording the information with the county;

Avoid impacts to regulated wetlands, buffers, expanded buffers, waterways, 100-year floodplains, and steep slopes or highly erodible soils as described in COMAR 26.23.01.04C that may cause an adverse impact to the nontidal wetland of special State concern;
Restrict regulated activities to the minimum area necessary to meet the project purpose;
Maintain existing groundwater recharge to the nontidal wetland of special State concern and tributaries to nontidal wetlands of special State concern by limiting impervious surfaces;

Use nonstructural stormwater management practices consistent with those in COMAR 26.17.02, to the extent practicable, such as infiltration, retention of forest, wetlands, and associated buffers, undisturbed floodplains, open space, and steep slopes, in association with structural stormwater management on properties with nontidal wetlands of special State concern or tributaries to nontidal wetlands of special State concern;
Manage runoff so that there is no direct discharge of stormwater into wetlands or waterways;
Restrict impervious surface on the project site to 15 percent or less, where practicable;
Install sediment controls such as super silt fences or comparable controls to completely surround all disturbed areas and maintain controls daily;
Stabilize disturbed areas daily with noninvasive native species;

Place vegetative waste, including yard waste, grass clippings, leaves, etc. or other debris outside of regulated wetlands, expanded buffers, waterways, and 100-year floodplains that are in the drainage area of the nontidal wetland of special State concern; or
Use other management practices listed in COMAR 26.23.03.02.
